level.heading: Power to hold property; title to trust property.
level.text: A statutory trust may hold or take title to property in its own name or in the name of a trustee in the trustee's capacity as trustee, whether in an active, passive, or custodial capacity.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under ยง 29-101.01.

level.heading: Uniform Law:
level.text: This section is based on ยง 307 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act . See Vol. 6B , Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.
